data.title: North Light rewards StouteÂ’s faith in Fallon
data.meta_description: GREAT trainers, like great football managers, are judged on their decisions. Sir Michael Stoute is not known for rushing the decisions that matter, but nor is he known for changing his mind. At Epsom
data.text:
GREAT trainers, like great football managers, are judged on their decisions. Sir Michael Stoute is not known for rushing the decisions that matter, but nor is he known for changing his mind. At Epsom on Saturday, his status as the finest in his field was amplified by his faith in a jockey whom lesser men would have discarded like a fake diamond.

When Kieren Fallon propelled North Light to the front of the Vodafone Derby field an audacious distance from home, he was repaying Stoute in the only way he knew how, with a towering display of strength and judgment. It did not purge him of all that has gone before, but only a curmudgeon could decline to celebrate a partnership to match any in
